mods.abstract: $50 Reward. RUNAWAY from my residence, in Upshur county, Texas, on the 11th inst., a very light complexioned girl, called VIOLETTE. She has light hair, blue eyes, and is rather stoutly made. When last heard of she was in the neighborhood of Shreveport, disguised in male attire, consisting of a blue cloth dress coat, blue pantaloons, black hat, slipper shoes, (no heels,) and white shirt. She may be at first sight taken for a white person. The above reward of $50, will be paid to any one who will return said girl to the undersigned, or place her in prison so that he can get her again. A. M. MOBLEY. Upshur coun ty, Texas, Sept. 27, 1854 2t
mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )
mods.accessCondition: E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments about the collection.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
